class_notes:
Course Description: 
This course will offer guidance and support to students conducting research for their honors theses in English, which are due in mid-Spring. While providing information about diverse theoretical approaches to literary research, the course will focus on offering practical advice on how to develop a major research project in English and how to research and write a first draft. Above all, the class will aim to build solidarity among students conducting innovative projects and to develop awareness of the privileges and responsibilities of participating in a research community. The seminar requirements include weekly readings, presentations, the drafting and revision of a thesis prospectus, and the drafting of a substantial portion of the thesis.
course_description: Fall semester. Required of honors students (other seniors may enroll with permission of director of undergraduate studies). Readings in the theory and practice of literary criticism. Designed to assist honors students in researching their theses.
